activities.instructions: Squat down until your legs are parallel to the floor. Then stand back up. Keep your back straight and abs flexed throughout the movement.
activities.name: Bodyweight Squat

activities.instructions: Put the barbell on your upper back and squat down until your thighs are parallel to the floor. Then stand back up. Keep your back straight and abs flexed throughout the movement.
activities.name: Barbell Squat

activities.instructions: Sit down in the machine and put your feet up against the plate as if you were doing a Squat. Unrack the weight and lower it down until your knee is at a 90 degree angle, then push it back up. Stop just before your legs are fully straight to relieve your knees from extra stress.
activities.name: Machine Leg Press

activities.instructions: Sit down in the machine and grab the handles at your sides. Place the padding just below your calves so that your legs are fully extended for the starting position. Curl them down until you have a 90 degree angle at your knee and then return back to the fully extended position.
activities.name: Machine Leg Curl

activities.instructions: Adjust the machine so that you're sitting comfortably and the seat ends just before your knee. Fully extend your legs while keeping the rest of your body stationary, then lower them back down to the starting position.
activities.name: Machine Leg Extension

activities.instructions: Stand up in the machine with the pads on your shoulders, unrack the weight and lower it all the way down so that you feel a good stretch in your calves. Push it all the way up and then lower it back down slowly, pausing at the bottom for a second or two to avoid pushing with your achilles heel.
activities.name: Machine Calf Raise

activities.instructions: Stand up with a dumbbell in each arm. Swing them up to shoulder height and have your elbows pointed straight out to your sides. Begin the movement by pressing the dumbbells straight up simultaneously until your arms are straight. Then finish it off by bringing them back down to shoulder height.
activities.name: Dumbbell Shoulder Press

activities.instructions: Facing the machine, sit on the seat on the edge and rest your chin on the seat.
activities.name: Machine Delt Fly (angled)

activities.instructions: Stand up and grab one dumbbell in each hand so that they're resting on the front of your thighs and your palms are facing inwards against you. Lift the dumbbells all the way up to your chin and then lower them back down.
activities.name: Upright Dumbbell Row

activities.instructions: Stand with one dumbbell in each hand so that they are touching your sides. While keeping your arms almost straight, raise the dumbbells up to the sides until they are just below shoulder level.
activities.name: Dumbbell Side Raise

activities.instructions: Sit on a bench in a smith machine without the back support. Keep abs flexed to support your back throughout the movement and start off by unhitching the weight from the smith machine at shoulder level, then push it straight up and then lower it back down.
activities.name: Smith Machine Shoulder Press

activities.instructions: Hang freely from a pull-up-bar with a little less than a shoulder width grip. Your palms should be facing inwards against you. Pull yourself up until your chin is above the bar. Then lower yourself back down until your arms are fully stretched. See Weighted Chins if you are using extra weights.
activities.name: Chinup

activities.instructions: Just like a regular Pull-Up but instead of pulling your weight up you will start off by jumping up to the top position of the movement. Then lower yourself down slowly.
activities.name: Eccentric Pullup

activities.instructions: Have a barbell on the floor in front of you. With legs straight and abs flexed, reach down and grab it at a shoulder wide grip. Stand up straight with the barbell in your hand. Finish the repetition by lowering it back down to the floor.
activities.name: Romanian Deadlift

activities.instructions: Put a barbell on the floor against the wall with one end and stand over it so that the other end goes between your legs. Have a V handle attached to the end of the barbell. Bend over and grab it with both arms and pull the weight towards your abs, then lower it back down. Keep back straight and abs flexed throughout the movement.
activities.name: Bent-Over T-Bar Row

activities.instructions: Sit on the machine with a slight bend in your knees. Bend over forward to grab the handles and sit up straight. While keeping your upper body stationary, pull the weight towards your abs and then return it back to the starting position.
activities.name: Machine Cable Low Row

activities.instructions: Sit down in a pulldown machine with the paddings adjusted so that they comfortably hold your legs down when you're holding the bar. Grab the wide pulldown bar with your palms facing forward at a little more than shoulder width apart. Slightly lean back so that you arch your lower back and puff your chest up, then pull the bar down by drawing your shoulders and upper arms down and back. Once the bar touches your chest, slowly begin to raise the bar back to the starting position, allowing your lat muscles to stretch out more the further up you go.
activities.name: Wide-Grip Machine Lat Pulldown

activities.instructions: Lie down on a flat bench with one dumbbell in each hand. Get the dumbbells in position above your chest and then begin the movement by lowering them down towards your chest. Then push them back up. Tip: Kick the dumbbells up to starting position with the help of your thighs.
activities.name: Dumbbell Bench Press

activities.instructions: Lie down on a regular bench with one dumbbell in each hand. Get the dumbbells in position above your chest and then begin the movement by lowering them out to your sides. You can imagine yourself hugging a giant tree on the way up, and then letting go as you lower them down. Go all the way down until your elbows are at the same level as your body. Tip: Squeeze your chest together at the top of the movement as if you were squeezing a football!
activities.name: Dumbbell Fly

activities.instructions: Lie down on an inclined bench with one dumbbell in each hand. Get the dumbbells in position above your chest and then begin the movement by lowering them down towards your upper chest. Then push them back up. Tip: Kick the dumbbells up to starting position with the help of your thighs.
activities.name: Incline Dumbbell Bench Press

activities.instructions:
Machines can differ from each other but in general you should adjust the seat so that you're seated with your back against the padding and have the handles just below shoulder height. 

Grab onto them and push them in towards each other as if you were hugging someone in front of you. Pause when the handles reach each other and then slowly return them back to the starting position.
activities.name: Machine Fly

activities.instructions: Lie down on a declined bench with one dumbbell in each hand. Get the dumbbells in position above your chest and then begin the movement by lowering them down towards your lower chest. Then push them back up. Tip: Kick the dumbbells up to starting position with the help of your thighs.
activities.name: Decline Dumbbell Bench Press

activities.instructions: Lie down on a flat bench in a smith machine. Unhitch the barbell when you're ready and begin the movement by lowering it down towards your chest. Then push it back up.
activities.name: Smith Machine Bench Press

activities.instructions: A simple pushup. Lie down on the floor and push yourself up. Can be done on the knuckles if you feel wrist pain.
activities.name: Pushup

activities.instructions: Stand in a dip station or between two steady bars. Grab the bars so that both your palms are facing inwards against you and begin the movement by lowering yourself down until your elbows are at shoulder level. Then push yourself back up.
activities.name: Chest Dip

activities.instructions: Lie down flat on a bench with two dumbbells. Position yourself under the dumbbells so that they're above your chest. Begin the movement by bending your elbows and lowering the dumbbells behind your head until your triceps are fully stretched. Then push them back up so that they end up above your chest.
activities.name: Lying Dumbbell Skull Crusher

activities.instructions: Stand up with one dumbbell in each hand. Keep your elbows tucked in at your sides as you curl the dumbbells up until they're at shoulder level. Then lower them back down to the sides of your thighs.
activities.name: Dumbbell Curl

activities.instructions: Stand in a cable machine with a bar attached to the handle. The handle should be at shoulder height. Grab it with overhand grip so that your palms are facing downwards towards the floor. Tuck your elbows in at your sides and push the bar down towards your thighs, then lower it back up.
activities.name: Cable Pushdown (with Bar Handle)

activities.instructions: Stand up right next to a cable machine with a bar attached to it. Grab it and keep your elbows tucked in to your sides, then simply curl the weight up to shoulder level. Lower it back down slowly until your arms are fully extended.
activities.name: Cable Curl

activities.instructions: Stand in a cable machine and have the handle behind you, above your head. Grab the handle and push it forward until your arms are fully stretched. Then lower it back so that it ends up behind your head again.
activities.name: Cable Overhead Pushdown

activities.instructions: Stand up with one dumbbell in each hand. Grab them as if you were grabbing two bottles so that your palms are facing inwards. Keep your palms facing inwards and curl the dumbbells all the way up, then lower them back down.
activities.name: Dumbbell Hammer Curl

activities.instructions: A simple pushup. Lie down on the floor and push yourself up. Can be done on the knuckles if you feel wrist pain.
activities.name: Pushup

activities.instructions: Just like a regular Pull-Up but instead of pulling your weight up you will start off by jumping up to the top position of the movement. Then lower yourself down slowly.
activities.name: Eccentric Pullup

activities.instructions: Get ready for a regular chin up, but instead of pulling yourself up you will jump up so that you're at the top position and start off the movement by slowly lowering your body back down.
activities.name: Eccentric Chinup

activities.instructions: Just like a regular pushup but you will have a very narrow grip so that your fingers are touching each other. Lower yourself down and push yourself up.
activities.name: Close-Grip Pushup

activities.instructions: Lie flat on the ground and put your elbows down so that your standing on them and your toes. Keep back and abs tight and hold the position for as long as you can.
activities.name: Plank

activities.instructions: Squat down until your legs are parallel to the floor. Then stand back up. Keep your back straight and abs flexed throughout the movement.
activities.name: Bodyweight Squat

activities.instructions: Begin the exercise by taking a big step forward with one leg at a time, lowering your body against the floor in each step until your rear knee almost touches the floor. Then raise your body back up and return to your starting position, swap leg for your next step.
activities.name: Bodyweight Lunge

activities.instructions: Hang freely from a pull-up-bar with a little less than a shoulder width grip. Your palms should be facing inwards against you. Pull yourself up until your chin is above the bar. Then lower yourself back down until your arms are fully stretched. See Weighted Chins if you are using extra weights.
activities.name: Chinup

activities.instructions: Just like a regular Pull-Up but instead of pulling your weight up you will start off by jumping up to the top position of the movement. Then lower yourself down slowly.
activities.name: Eccentric Pullup

activities.instructions: A simple pushup. Lie down on the floor and push yourself up. Can be done on the knuckles if you feel wrist pain.
activities.name: Pushup

activities.instructions: Put a pair of dumbbells on the floor in front of you on the floor. Position your feet at hip width apart, slightly bend your knees, bend over with a straight back, and grab both dumbbells with a neutral grip. Pull both dumbbells towards the side of your abs and then slowly let them back down until your arms are straight.
activities.name: Bent-Over Dumbbell Row

activities.instructions: Lie down on a flat bench with one dumbbell in each hand. Get the dumbbells in position above your chest and then begin the movement by lowering them down towards your chest. Then push them back up. Tip: Kick the dumbbells up to starting position with the help of your thighs.
activities.name: Dumbbell Bench Press

activities.instructions: Sit and grab a dumbbell with an underhand grip. Rest your arm on your thigh and let the dumbbell roll all the way out to your fingers. Then squeeze it with your fingers so that the dumbbell ends up in the middle of your palm again.
activities.name: Dumbbell Wrist Curl
